Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Delivered by: Imam Dr. Tahir Kukaj serves as the spiritual leader of the Albanian Islamic Cultural Center, located at 307 Victory Boulevard, Staten Island, NY 10301.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Rose.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Dr. Tahir Kukaj serving as spiritual leader of the Albanian Islamic Cultural Center, located at 307 Victory Boulevard, Staten Island, NY 10301.

Council Member Rose moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the United States Department of Agriculture to expand the number of retailers that are permitted in the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program online purchasing program to ensure vulnerable communities in New York City can safely access healthy food.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: US Dept of Agriculture to expand the number of retailers that are permitted in the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program online purchasing program to ensure vulnerable communities in NYC can safely access healthy food.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to expanding the collection of certain demographic data by city agencies
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Expanding the collection of certain demographic data by city agencies.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring towing companies to remove debris from the scene of an accident
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing
Items.MatterName: Requiring towing companies to remove debris from the scene of an accident.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State Legislature to pass, and Governor to sign, A.03269 and S.02490, requiring putrescible and non-putrescible waste to be covered by a hard tarp when transported by rail.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Requiring putrescible and non-putrescible waste to be covered by a hard tarp when transported by rail. (A.03269 and S.02490)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to requiring standby power for nursing homes, adult homes, enriched housing and certain assisted living facilities
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring standby power for nursing homes, adult homes, enriched housing and certain assisted living facilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to license, permit, consent and registration renewal extensions, and requiring at least 45 days notice for renewal following the COVID-19 emergency
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs and Business Licensing
Items.MatterName: License, permit, consent and registration renewal extensions, and requiring at least 45 days notice for renewal following the COVID-19 emergency.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring health insurance coverage for surviving family members of municipal employees who died as a result of a complication related to the coronavirus disease, COVID-19
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Requiring health insurance coverage for surviving family members of municipal employees who died as a result of a complication related to COVID-19.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, legislation automatically classifying the deaths of all municipal employees who died from COVID-19 as line-of-duty deaths.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Automatically classifying the deaths of all municipal employees who died from COVID-19 as line-of-duty deaths.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to organic waste drop off sites
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Sanitation and Solid Waste Management
Items.MatterName: Organic waste drop off sites.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to requiring the creation and distribution of a guide regarding changes in the policies and procedures of the department of social services/human resources administration due to COVID-19
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Creation and distribution of a guide regarding changes in the policies and procedures of the department of social services/human resources administration due to COVID-19.

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo).

There were 50 Council Members marked present at this remote Stated Meeting.


     At the time of this Stated Meeting, there was one vacant seat on the Council in the 37th District (Brooklyn) pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of the November 3, 2020 General Election.
At this point the Speaker (Council Member Johnson) made the following announcements:

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Johnson), the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo) adjourned to meet again on Thursday, May 28, 2020.

MICHAEL McSWEENEY, City Clerk
Clerk of the Council
The Majority Leader (Council Member Cumbo) presiding as the Acting President Pro Tempore

The Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Cumbo)  put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports, which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

Items.Title: Application Number 20205412 HAM (266 West 96th Street) submitted by the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development pursuant to section 576-a(2) of the New York State Private Housing Finance Law for the disposition city-owned property located at 266 West 96th Street (Block 1243, Lot 57), Borough of Manhattan, Council District 6, Community District 7.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Application was Referred to Comm by Council to the Subcommittee on Landmarks, Public Sitings and Dispositions
Items.MatterName: Landmarks, 266 West 96th Street, Manhattan (20205412 HAM)

Items.Title: Passed The Consent Agenda
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that these files be approved by consent vote.
